TopicTitle: Fuel crossfeed problem with Mk3 parts

Articles.Content:
Got a strange fuel crossfeed problem.

My helo has four tanks - 2 in the head and 2 in the tail. Everything is connected with fuel pipes or with Wing Connectors C. The C connector is fuel aware (i.e. transfering in any direction) and the pipes point a correct direction.

The fuel then is collected via a top-mounted Oscar acting as a fuel hub and fed directly to the engines. But the rear tanks are not working! So, the fuel hub fails.

 

Faced the similar issues since 1.0.5 when a "crossfeed enabled" pylon does not feed any fuel through the Mk3 parts. Or the fuselages themselves are not transfering the fuel despites they should. It seems that the problem arise only with Mk3 parts.

 

Did anybody face the same problem?

Hi Astra, if you upload the craft to dropbox other people can have a look and try to fix it.

Or at least put some pics on imgur for us

sal_vager, i have already fixed it with TT-38s, but this is not the first time i face a problem like this with Mk3 parts... i had exactly the same issue with an Mk3 engine mount.

The engine mounted on completely refused to drain any  fuel from a tank attached via small pylon; the fuel crossfeed was definitely enabled.

Edited February 10, 2016 by _Astra_
